title: ‚ÄòThe Voice: Battle of Champions‚Äô Expanding to Two Hours For Season¬†29
summary: The upcoming season will kick off on Feb. 23 and will mark the reunion of judges Kelly Clarkson, John Legend and Adam Levine and feature a number of format changes.
body: There will be more of The Voice to love in season 29. NBC announced on Wednesday (Feb. 4) that the upcoming season of the reality singing competition will be super-sized into two-hour episodes at 9 p.m. ET on Monday nights when it returns on Feb. 23. That switch-up means that The Voice will enjoy one hour when it is not up against longtime rival American Idol , which airs from 8-10 p.m. ET on Mondays on ABC. The bump also means that the Zachary Quinto-led drama Brilliant Minds will be benched for a while after already being put on ice for the next two weeks due to the Winter Olympics. The upcoming Voice season will also mark the return of OG coach Adam Levine , who inhabited one of the red chairs for the show’s first 16 seasons, as well as season 27. He’ll take a seat for the first-ever three-coach lineup alongside fellow alums Kelly Clarkson (seasons 14-21 and 23) and John Legend (16-22, 24-25, 27). There will be some format updates as well, with NBC promising a “landmark” season filled with “fast-paced, competitive elements, delivering a fresh twist on the format that raises the stakes for coaches and artists alike.” Among the tweaks are a &#8‚Ä¶

The first music expected to be released under the deal will come from We the Band ‚Äî the longtime backing band for Justin Bieber ‚Äî who signed with Avex in June. summary: The singer has repeatedly spoken out about her contentious relationship with her kin since her restrictive 13-year conservatorship ended in Nov. 2021.
body: Britney Spears is once again speaking out about her strained, painful relationship with her family. In fact, in an Instagram post on Wednesday (Feb. 3), Spears, 44, claimed that she is “lucky to be alive” given how her have treated her over the years. And while Spears did not name names or get into specifics, the lengthy post accompanied by an image of a baby holding a woman’s hand appeared to be a form of catharsis for the pop star who has effectively retired from public life. “As people, all we really want is to feel connected to each other and never feel alone ‚Ä¶ for those of you in your family that have said to help you is to isolate you and make you feel unbelievably left out ‚Ä¶ they were wrong,” Spears wrote. “We can forgive as people but u don‚Äôt ever forget. Yearning and longing for contact is always crucial !!! I‚Äôm incredibly lucky to even be alive with how my family treated me once in my life and now I‚Äôm scared of them. It‚Äôs weird how God works in mysterious ways,” she continued. “My friends, what do you think he is saying today ??? Because to be totally honest with you, no matter what he says, they will never take responsibil‚Ä¶

title: This is the only reason I still buy flagship Android phones in 2026

body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority There are plenty of reasons to buy flagship Android phones , such as bleeding-edge performance, wireless charging support, and premium designs. Needless to say, you‚Äôre often getting a lot of features and perks by paying a premium. However, colleague Andrew Grush recently questioned whether flagship phones are still worth it . title: Google Photos wants to become your go-to app for making collages
summary: So it's testing new editing features that should been here already.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing new editing options within the Collage Editor inside Google Photos. The changes include new settings to customize the frame‚Äôs thickness, curvature, and color. It also organizes the editor‚Äôs options using a cleaner interface. I don‚Äôt know about you, but for me, Google Photos is the closest thing to a digital time capsule . I‚Äôve used it to back up my photos longer than any social media app has, and I expect to do so until Google lets the app live. Besides automatically generated memories, you can also revisit memories by creating collages within the Photos app. But if you use the built-in Collage Editor in Photos, you might find it limiting compared to other third-party apps. title: This 7-inch gaming handheld just made its unique controller modules free for a limited time
summary: An already sweet deal just got even sweeter, but only for early buyers.
body: Credit: YouTube TL;DR A few hours from release, MANGMI has added free microswitch modules for early buyers of the Pocket Max handheld. The device features a 7-inch OLED screen, Snapdragon 865, and swappable control modules. Super Early Bird pricing is $199, but it faces stiff competition from the AYN Odin 2 Portal. MANGMI is less than a day away from launching the cheapest 7-inch gaming handheld on the market, the Pocket Max , but the deal just became a little sweeter. Today, the company announced that all Super Early Bird orders will also include a free set of microswitch modules. The modular nature of the MANGMI Pocket Max is one of its most unique and confusing features. The device includes a set of soft membrane modules for the D-pad and buttons in the box, with additional clicky microswitch modules sold separately for $15 (previously $12). The modules can‚Äôt be moved to, say, put the D-pad above the sticks, but some gamers are very picky about their inputs.

title: There‚Äôs at least one reason to choose the Exynos Galaxy S26 over the Snapdragon version, for now
summary: Alas, you don't get to choose which variant your region gets.
body: Galaxy S26 Pro render Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR The Exynos-powered Galaxy S26 might feature better on-device AI with native image generation capabilities. Samsung is reportedly collaborating with another company to bring a lightweight version of Stable Diffusion for on-device image generation. The feature is expected to be called EdgeFusion and could generate 512-pixel images in ‚Äúa few seconds.‚Äù AI has now mutated into an integral part of our devices. But brands still use a hybrid AI arrangement, where only part of the processing occurs locally, with most of the lifting done by AI models in cloud infrastructure. On-device AI on phones, for instance, has largely been limited to processing text, while richer media, such as images, are processed online. As expected, the latter approach raises privacy concerns, but Samsung could take a step toward addressing them by bringing on-device image generation to the upcoming Galaxy S26 . According to the information received by the Korean news outlet Seoul Economic Daily , Samsung‚Äôs Exynos 2600 chipset will be capable of running text-to-image generation AI models without the internet on the Galaxy S26. The multiple systems can offer a combined power output of 90kW. As part of its CES 2026 showcase, Anker‚Äôs sub-brand SOLIX gave us a preview of its new integrated home backup solution, the SOLIX E10. Following that early look last month, nationwide sales of the E10 platform are opening today. SOLIX says the E10 is the world‚Äôs first ‚Äúsmart hybrid whole home backup system.‚Äù While the other bits are self-explanatory, hybrid here refers to its ability to run on multiple fuel options. In addition to its support for solar power and a battery-based backup solution , the E10 also supports traditional fuels such as propane, gasoline, and natural gas through the SOLIX Smart Generator 5500, which can be effective in scenarios with prolonged outages and scant sunlight.

title: Google is finally fixing one of Pixel‚Äôs biggest connectivity headaches in Android 16
summary: Google finally gives Pixel users granular control over Adaptive Connectivity in Android 16.
body: Image of a Pixel phone with Android‚Äôs Quick Settings on it. Original photo by Joe Maring. Gemini Nano Banana Pro was used to modify the photo and place the screenshot on the screen. TL;DR Google is updating Pixel‚Äôs vague Adaptive Connectivity with clearer controls in Android 16 QPR3 Beta 2. There‚Äôs a new ‚ÄúAuto-switch to mobile network‚Äù toggle that keeps you online when Wi-Fi is weak, but may use more data. The ‚ÄúOptimize network for battery life‚Äù toggle prioritizes efficiency to help extend battery life. Finding the right balance between a strong connection and a battery that lasts all day has always been tricky for smartphones. For years, Google‚Äôs Adaptive Connectivity was a simple switch that worked in the background, but it didn‚Äôt explain what it was doing. Now, with the latest Android 16 QPR3 Beta 2 update, Pixel phones are getting a more detailed version of that feature. The main change is that instead of a single on/off switch for Adaptive Connectivity, there are now two separate toggles, each with its own purpose. Both are turned on by default, as a Reddit user noticed (via 9to5Google ).

title: Samsung thinks you all want more Folds than Flips in 2026

This comes after the Galaxy Z Fold 7 reportedly outsold the Galaxy Z Flip 8 last year, despite Samsung originally planning to make more Flips. Samsung traditionally produces more Flip phones than Fold devices in a given year, as Flip foldables are significantly cheaper and tend to see more demand. However, it sounds like Samsung is planning to flip (heh) the script in 2026. Korean outlet ET News reports that Samsung plans to produce more Galaxy Z Fold 8 units than Galaxy Z Flip 8 devices this year. The website, citing industry sources, says Samsung will make 3.5 million Galaxy Z Fold 8 devices in 2026 versus 2.5 to 3 million Z Flip 8 units.

title: T-Mobile crushes Verizon and AT&T to be the fastest carrier in the US
summary: With an average network speed more than twice of Verizon's.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile has emerged as the fastest network in the US in H2 2025. It topped charts, with average peak speeds of 260Mbps overall and 310Mbps on 5G, while Verizon could only achieve 130Mbps. T-Mobile also ranked first in consistency and reliability, as per the report. Ookla, the company behind the iconic Speedtest.net, has released fresh insights about the leading carriers in the US based on their network speeds. According to this report, T-Mobile has emerged as the top service provider for the second half of 2025, with the highest download speeds. It repeats this feat after being established as the fastest carrier in the first half of 2025 as well. This report, according to Ookla, is based on speed tests performed by millions of users across the US. According to Ookla‚Äôs findings, T-Mobile‚Äôs average network speed stood at roughly 260Mbps, while its average 5G speed was nearly 310Mbps. Verizon, on the other hand, only recorded an average top speed of about 130Mbps, less than half of T-Mobile‚Äôs.

title: Android brands could copy iPhone 17‚Äôs coolest front camera trick
summary: Leaks suggest OPPO and HUAWEI are testing square sensors that eliminate the need to rotate your phone for group selfies.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR OPPO and HUAWEI are reportedly exploring square 1:1 front-facing camera sensors, similar to the 18MP ‚ÄúCenter Stage‚Äù camera on the iPhone 17 series. The technology could debut on the OPPO Find X10 series and the photography-focused HUAWEI Nova 16 series, scheduled for launch later this year or early next year. A square sensor allows users to take landscape or portrait selfies without physically rotating the phone by cropping into the sensor. One of the most underrated upgrades on the iPhone 17 series is the new 18MP ‚ÄúCenter Stage‚Äù front camera. While the camera itself is great, the party trick is that it uses a square sensor. This allows users to take selfies in landscape and portrait orientations without physically rotating their phone, as the company crops into the sensor for the shot. Android users could soon join in on the fun, as Android brands have started exploring a square selfie camera for their upcoming phones. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: AT&T and T-Mobile seem to be stronger than ever: Is Verizon in trouble?

body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority A decade ago, if I had told people that T-Mobile would eventually be considered the fastest network in the US and that the brand would become the de facto leader in many ways, I‚Äôm sure I would have had a hard time finding anyone who believed me. Well, at least outside of T-Mobile‚Äôs most ardent fans. Yet, here we are at the beginning of 2026, and slowly but surely we seem to be heading in this direction. In 2025, T-Mobile won several awards from major survey companies, including Ookla, and largely became known as the king of network speed . Even AT&T is finally striking harder at the competition , particularly T-Mobile.

title: YouTube TV‚Äôs feud with Disney cost ESPN some serious money
summary: Disney's standoff with YouTube TV was more costly than expected.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube TV and Disney reached a distribution agreement in November, ending a multi-week blackout of Disney content on the platform. A new report now reveals how big a financial hit Disney‚Äôs sports broadcasting arm suffered due to the blackout. ESPN‚Äôs daily revenue loss was over $7 million per day, totaling a loss of over $110 million in operational revenue. Last year, in October, Google announced it was in negotiations with Disney to keep networks like ABC and ESPN on YouTube TV. As the two parties failed to reach an agreement before the then-existing licensing deal expired, a Disney media blackout ensued. Although both corporations were predicted to lose millions during the blackout, the situation wasn‚Äôt resolved until mid-November . Now we‚Äôre starting to learn just how big a financial impact that blackout had on Disney. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?
